text: [Music]
doctors at the el Vampiro psychiatric
hospital in central venezuela invited us
this summer to document a chilling new
reality their treating patients in a
country where there were virtually no
drugs
this is margarita she has schizophrenia
and had no medication when we met her
she was being held in solitary
confinement since the night before we
arrived when she left unto her bunkmate
and bit off her nose the victim Cleo
Fela was in another room being consoled
by her sister in the - were still in
shock there's a shortage of medication
because of Venezuela's economy the
collapse in oil prices and years of
economic mismanagement has meant the
country doesn't have the hard currency
to report many of the drugs these
patients need to recordin arey lives the
el Vampiro hospital is only the start of
the problem outside these walls
thousands of other patients have been
released if their hospitals could not
treat them
[Music]
we get out we cassi here in the
nurse's station kind of triage is
happening it was a typical day when we
arrived there were some medicines of the
cabinet but not enough for everyone
now the nurses had to make a difficult
decision of which patients would receive
their pills and which would not was the
most stable whose suffering the most
emiliana did not receive her medication
that she needed she has suffered from
schizophrenia for years and is confined
to a wheelchair she moaned throughout
the day of our visit the nurses told us
she has little food and no medication
from her glaucoma which they say has
spread and leaves her barely able to see
she seemed trapped in another world
hardly able to speak to us we could only
make out a few words
I'm not crazy she said I'm hungry
emiliana was eventually taken to her bed
she continued her pleas nurses told us
about another Emiliana years before she
came here when she was young she was
educated white and always clean they
said it was after her husband died years
ago the first signs of schizophrenia
appeared that's when she was brought
here to help on petal by her family
[Music]
the hospital also suffers from shortages
of nearly everything else they might
need there's no soap no shampoo no
toothpaste and no toilet paper without
medication patients relieve themselves
in common areas and in the patio they
clean themselves with just water they've
run out of new clothes as well and
what's left barely fits or has holes
nurses have made makeshift belts out of
pieces of rope to keep clothes from
sliding off patients who are getting
gaunt for lack of food the backward in
the men's ward some of the patients had
violent behavior towards their families
four doctors diagnosed them with
schizophrenia nurses fear they are more
likely to revert to violence again when
they are unmedicated yet life continues
here it must with medications or without
them and the nurses and patients pray
for the day when the country will be
stable again for the new york times this
is Nicholas Casey
you
